required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anastrozole Monotherapy Versus Maximal Oestrogen Blockade With Anastrozole and Fulvestrant Combination Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: FACT: Anastrozole Monotherapy Versus Maximal Oestrogen Blockade With Anastrozole and Fulvestrant Combination Therapy; an Open Randomized, Comparative, Phase III Multicentre Study in Postmenopausal Women With Hormone Receptor Positive Breast Cancer in First Relapse After Primary Treatment of Localized Tumor.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy of anastrozole monotherapy versus maximal oestrogen blockade with combinated therapy of fulvestrant and anastrozole compared with in treatment of hormone receptor positive women with first relapse of breast cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: RECIST assessments carried out every 8 weeks from randomisation until data cut-off on 30th April 2009
primary_outcome.description: RECIST (Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours) assessments carried out every 8 weeks from randomisation until data cut-off on 30th April 2009. TTP, time in months to worsen 'progression' according to RECIST criteria. (RECIST is a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve "respond", stay the same "stable"or worsen "progression" during treatments.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Evaluable Participants With Objective Response Rate (ORR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: RECIST tumour assessments carried out every 8 weeks from randomisation until data cut-off on 30th April 2009
secondary_outcome.description: No. of patients who were objective responders over the no. of patients evaluable for response x100. An objective responder = a patient whose best response is either CR (disappearance of all lesions) or PR (>= 30% shrinkage in the sum of the longest diamemeters of the measurable lesions + no new lesions + no progression of non-measurable lesions)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Clinical Benefit Rate (CBR) Responders
secondary_outcome.time_frame: RECIST tumour assessments carried out every 8 weeks from randomisation until data cut-off on 30th April 2009
secondary_outcome.description: No. of patients who were clinical benefit responders over the no. of randomised patients x100. A clinical benefit responder = a patient whose best response is CR, PR or SD>=24 weeks (where a best response of SD = no new lesions and for existing lesions; neither suffient shrinkage to count as PR nor sufficient growth to count as progression)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: RECIST tumour assessments carried out every 8 weeks from randomisation until data cut-off on 30th April 2009
secondary_outcome.description: Median time from randomisation until objective progression or death (in the absence of objective progression), measured only in those patients who are objective responders

secondary_outcome.time_frame: RECIST tumour assessments carried out every 8 weeks from randomisation until data cut-off on 30th April 2009
secondary_outcome.description: Median time from randomisation until objective progression or death (in the absence of objective progression), measured only in those patients who are clinical benefit responders

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomisation until data cut-off on 30th April 2009
secondary_outcome.description: Time from randomisation until the date of discontinuation of randomised treatment for any reason

secondary_outcome.time_frame: All deaths occurring between randomisation and data cut-off on 30th April 2009 are included.
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is equivalent to time to death. Time from randomisation until the date of death

intervention.description: intramuscular injection 250 mg loading dose (LD) regimen

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent, postmenopausal females, histological or cytological confirmed oestrogene and/or progesterone (PgR) receptor positive breast cancer, local recurrence or metastasis
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous systemic endocrine therapy for advanced or recurrent disease; prior fulvestrant therapy
- Premenopausal women

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 258 patients were randomised to Fulvestrant + Anastrozole and 256 patients were randomised to Anastrozole. In each treatment group, there were 2 patients who did not receive any trial therapy and so have been excluded from the safety summaries.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that they cannot disclose or publish any information to do with the trial without consent from AstraZeneca
